result.title: Objective
result.description: Mechanisms for payment for ecosystem services (ES) are tested and replication systems developed to ensure the protection of natural ecosystems of Argentina and the services provided by these

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1.Number of schemes and hectares under PES schemes in pilot areas

baseline.comment: No PES under implementation with differential payment reflecting amounts of ES provided

target.comment: By end of project 4 PES schemes covering 145,000 hectares

actual.comment: Four PES schemes for Chaco, Formosa, Entre Rios and Misiones have been designed and under different levels of implementation. Total area covered by the four PES schemes is 85,000 ha after correcting area in Misiones pilot site.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description:
2. Number of hectares identified with conditions for replication upon project termination:
a) In pilot provinces
b) Outside project area

target.comment: a) In pilot Provinces Chaco: 4.5 million ha of forests Formosa 3.5 million ha of forests Entre Rios: 2.5 million ha with high erosion risk Jujuy TbD upon Project start up b) Outside Project area 4.5 million hectares

actual.comment:
In Chaco, the provincial government has adopted the Project´s technical guidelines to design forest management plans (Disposición Nro 172/15) as the base for applying the PES scheme to about 4,5 millón ha of forests categorized under the National Forest Protection Law. In Formosa, the Project has the commitment of the governamental authorities to replicate Project´s lessons in its jurisdiction (about 3,5 million ha of forests). In Entre Ríos, a bill to incorporate payment for carbon and biodiversity ES into the Provincial Conservation Law has been presented to the local Legislature covering about 2 million ha of soil under erosion risk . In Misiones, the Project has the commitment from the provincial government and several Watershed Committees (about 60,000 ha) to replicate Project´s lessons and snd PES design.
Outside Pilot Areas: i) activities regarding development of Forest Conservation Indicators and Forest Management Plans have been initiated wint the province of La Pampa with a replication potencial in 2,5 millon ha of Calden forest; ii) The Project is participating into the SAyDS Program on Forest Managenment with Integrated Livestock (PFMIL). The PFMIL will be applied to about 12 million ha of forest in the Northern part of the country; iii) activities to replicate Project´lessons have been carried out (capacitation workshops on SE and PES) with two Watershed Committees in Misiones Province (Jabotí and Tabay) covering about 60,000 ha.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. % increase in the composition of representative communities and/or functional groups of the ecosystems in project\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s intervention area

baseline.comment: Information available at regional areas

target.comment: Herbaceous and shrub species: 10% and ground cover 15%; tree seedlings: 5% in species and 5% in abundance; pollinating insects: 10% in families; predatory arthropods: 10% in families; birds: 10% in species (5% for raptors and 5% for insectivores)

actual.comment: Biodiversity baselines in the four Pilot Sites are completed. Composition and abundance of different taxonomic groups (i.e., vegetation, mammals, bats, and birds) have been established for the most representative ecological habitats/communities in the four Pilot Sites. Information from baseline will be used to estimate % increase in the composition of representative communities/functional groups at the end of Project after ES providers have made land use changes and adopted Project´s prescribed conservation practices.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. Tons of CO2 sequestered and/or avoided emissions within the framework of implemented PES schemes

baseline.comment: Estimated total baseline emissions of 2,227,792 t CO2 in 545,000 has

target.comment: Emissions reduced in 145,000 hectares: 437,736 t CO2

actual.comment: Total emission reductions to be determined after landowners implement land use changes according to management plans.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 5. Percentage of increase in income of ES providers participating in the PES schemes

target.comment: By PY4 income is at least the same or higher than before entering the PES scheme

actual.comment: To be determined after PES implementation in the four pilot sites at the end of the Project.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Knowledge base on ecosystems services expanded with models and tools to facilitate decision making regarding the trade-off of different land uses

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. Biodiversity and carbon benefits measured and monitored in each pilot site

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: Baselines in PY1 and monitoring in PY4

actual.comment: Baselines established in all four pilot sites. Monitoring of effects of land changes uses on ES to be monitored at the end of the Project.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2. Number of models developed to quantify the level of ES per land use, relative profitability and economic value

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: By PY1 4 models developed (1 per pilot site)

actual.comment: Four GIS-based models under different stages of development in the four pilot sites. In Chaco: model developed and tested for 35 farmers, work is underway to extrapolte to the entire pilot site. In Formosa: model is under development for 23 farmers. In Entre Rios: model is underway and calibration (with the collaboration from governament ofices) for the entire pilot site. In Misiones: model is underway to integrate the different information levels for the entire watershed.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. Number of decision makers and technical staff of SAyDS and INTA with capacities strengthened on ES and trade-offs between ES/land uses

baseline.comment: Low levels of training and knowledge on ES

target.comment: By PY2 at least 25% of the staffs of the substantive areas of SAyDS and INTA ´s regional units involved in the project

actual.comment: More tan 75% of the substantive staff from SAyDS (about 15 personnel) and INTA (about 40 personnel) related to Project topics (i.e., forest, soils, water, biodiversity, economics, GIS, management plan formulation, PES design and monitoring) are involved in the Poject. In addition, training to strengthen capacities and knowledge on ES and PES has to continue to different audiences and decisión-makers: In Chaco and Formosa: 25 decisión-makers and technical staff form the provincial government, 10 researchers from de regional university and 15 professionals from the private sector were trained on forest management plan design aimed at ES conservation and on ES importance in land planning. In Misiones: a course on "PES oriented to water services" was conducted to membersof the San ramón Watershed Committee (27 participants). In Entre Ríos, two workshops on ES and PES design were offered to 25 personnel from INTA, the provincial government and the local university.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Know-how on effective operational set-ups for optimizing benefits from existing and potential ES incentives is expanded and reinforced through field demonstrations of different PES schemes

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1.PES schemes and monitoring mechanisms designed and validated with provincial authorities and local stakeholders

baseline.comment: Existing incentives lack specific mechanisms to implement PES schemes that secure global benefits

target.comment: By PY1 3 PES schemes under Government incentives (Chaco, Formosa and Entre Rios) and 1 classical PES scheme (Jujuy)

actual.comment: Four PES schemes are under different stages of implementation in the four pilot sites. In Entre Rios, all technical and operative aspects for the PES scheme have been completed and jointly developed with provincial authorities. The provincial government, who is in charge of executing the PES, decided that before proceeding to make any compensation under the new compensation scheme, it will incorporate the compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the body of the Provincial Soil Conservation Law (a bill proposal in that direction is currently under discussion in the provincial Legislature). In addition, 30 farmers are preparing systematization plans for their farms under the Project´s approach. In Misiones, all aspects regarding institutional and administrative arrangements (i.e., contracts, administration of funds, monitoring and certification of land use plans, etc) needed to put into place the PES scheme have been completed and validated with key actors, such as the Cooperativa de Servicios de Oberá (in charge of collecting and disbursing the payments), the Municipalities of Oberá and Campo Ramón (where beneficiaries are located) and the San Ramón Watershed Committee (the overseeing institution). Although farmers located in critical areas for water services are being capacitated for developing management plans to receive the payment, the Cooperative of Oberá has requested to postpone for 2016 the application of the PES scheme in order to adjust water tariffs (water tariffs need to be adjusted by 40% to be according to inflation a provision costs) before including a charge for ES in the water bill. In Chaco and Formosa, technical and operative aspects of the PES scheme associated to the National Forest Conservation Law 26331 have been designed by the Project. Amounts to be paid by ES are still under discussion among national and provincial authorities under the aegis of the project. Although farmers participating in the project elaborated and presented their management plans following the Project´ PES scheme guidelines at the end of 2014 to receive payment under Law 26331 in 2015 (27 in Chaco and 10 in Formosa), no payment has been made yet due to differences between national and provincial authorities regarding funds allocation for management plans of fermers participating in the Project.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2.% of landowners interested in participating in PES schemes that sign legal contracts

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 90% by PY2

actual.comment: 145 landowners are the target for the PES schemes in the four pilot sites (35 in Chaco, 23 In Formosa, 30 in Entre Rios and 57 in Misiones).

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. % of agreed upon land uses that are maintained by the end of the project

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 75% by PY4

actual.comment: Baseline still holds as agreement on land uses will be determined after PES schemes and management plans are implemented by landowners.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. % of audits carried out in time and in accordance with auditing procedures

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 80% annually between PY3 and 4

actual.comment: Baseline still hlds as auditing process will only start after PES are functioning

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 5. % of producers that stay in the PES scheme

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 75% by PY4

actual.comment: Seventy percent of landowners from Chaco and Formosa (41 out of 58) have already presented management plans (an indirect way to estbalish a legal contract for partcipating in the PES scheme) to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331, and the rest is in the process to do so. Landowners from Misiones are being capacitated on PES participation. Landowners from Entre Rios are awaiting passing of the bill adopting the new PES scheme to prepare and present thier management plans.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: 6.% of producers who have expressed their conformity with the design and implementation of the PES schemes

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 75% by PY4

actual.comment: Baseline values still holds as PES schemes will start functioning the next PY.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: 7. Costs and benefits of PES schemes assessed

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: By PY4 costs of sequestration of t/C versus costs of sequestration of t/C of the alternative

actual.comment: Estimates for the costs of sequestration of t/C of the alternative using forest plantations varies between US$ 17,47 and US$ 29,97 (without purchasing land) and US$ 29,71 and US$ 43,64 (with purchasing land) depending on the considered discounting and exchanging rates.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Provincial capacities strengthened to upscale pilot PES schemes to landscape levels

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1.Number of landowners willing to prepare management plans to participate in the PES scheme proposed by the project under the Forest and Soil laws

target.comment: By PY4 at least a total of 100 producers in Chaco, Formosa and Entre Rios

actual.comment: 41 landowners (Chaco: 27, Formosa: 14) prepared and presented management plans to be elegible for receiving payment under National Forest Law in 2014 (another 17 are in the process to do so). 30 farmers in Entre Rios are involved in the planning process for the sistematization of their farms pending the approval of the bill to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity conservation into the Provincial Sil Conservation Law.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2.Number of pilot Provinces that adjust their regulatory frameworks to enable up-scaling of PES at provincial level

target.comment: By PY4 Jujuy and Entre Rios

actual.comment: Lagal frameworks being adjusted to enable up-scaling at provincial levels are being carried out in Chaco, Entre Ríos y Misiones. In Chaco, a regulation (Disposición 175/2015) has been passed to norm that management plans to be presented to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331 must be developed under the Project guidelines. In Entre Rios, a bill proposal based on Project developments to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the Provincial Soil Conservation Law is under currently under discussion in the local Legislature. In Misiones, a study to adjust the existing legal framework for designing and executing PES scheme on water is currently underway in collaboration with the provincial government.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
3.Number of additional hectares in pilot provinces where PES schemes may be up-scaled
Number of decision makers, technical staff and auditors of provinces with capacities strengthened to provide oversight to up-scaling of PES schemes

target.comment:
By PY4 at least 2.5 million hectares in ER; 4.5 million hectares in Chaco and 3.5 million in Formosa. Jujuy to be determined upon project start-up
By PY4 at least 50% of staffs of relevant areas of the institutions involved

actual.comment:
In Chaco steps are being taken by provincial authorities to up-scale Project guidelines to 4,5 million ha. In Formosa, there is the commitment by provincial authorities to up-scale Project guidelines to 3,5 million ha. In Entre Ríos, after the bill proposal to include compensation for carbón and biodiversity ES is passed, the PES scheme will be up-scaled to 2,5 million ha. In Misiones, activities for replicating Project lessons directed to up-scaling to two watersheds are underway (about 60,000 ha).
All relevant decison-makers and staff from provincial governments in the four pilot sites related to the PES schemes are involved in PES design and up-scaling (Chaco: 10, Formosa: 7, Entre Ríos: 5, Misiones: 5).

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Enabling framework in place for up scaling PES geographically throughout Argentina and thematically to other PES schemes

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. Outreach program targeting the whole range of PES stakeholders (sellers, buyers and provincial governments responsible for oversight and monitoring) developed and validated.

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: By PY3 outreach program developed

actual.comment: Programs targeting a whole range of PES stakeholders developed and being implemented in the four pilot sites. Importance of ES in land use planning and of PES scheme as a conservation tool instaled in the four pilot sites.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2. Number of dissemination events organized and participants

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: By PY4 at least 10 regional workshops with at least 50 participants per workshop

actual.comment: There have been eight large workshops on ES and PES schemes (Chaco 3, Misiones 2, Entre Ríos 2 and Formosa 1) with a total of about 400 participants, including landowners, policy-makers, researchers and technical staff from the national and provincial governments. There has been also numerous (about 25) presentations/radio shows/meetings/conferences about Project objectives and activities directed to a wide range of audiences (i.e., farmers, general public, researchers, policy-makers) at the local, regional, national and international level during the reporting period. In addition, a paper describing the Project experience developing the PES scheme associated with the Forest Conservation Law 26331 in the Chaco Pilot Site has been accepted for publication in the XIV World Forestry Congress to be held in South Africa in September 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3. Proposal for PES law elaborated and validated with key stakeholders

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: By PY4 proposal elaborated and validated

actual.comment: Contacts are maintained with the Chairman of the Agricutural Comission of the National Congress to pursue the idea of a proposal on a PES national law based on project ´s lessons.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 4. Number of potential hectares identified where PES schemes may be applied

baseline.comment: Non-existent

target.comment: By PY4 4.5 million hectares

actual.comment: Number of hectares where PES schemes guidelines developed by the project are in the process of up-scaling: 7 million (Chaco 4,5 million; Entre Ríos 2,5 million). Number of potential hectares where PES scheme in provinces with pilot sites could be applied: i) Misiones: 600,000 hectares; ii) Formosa: 3,5 million hectares.

result.title: Objective
result.description: Reduce the risk of PCB exposure and emissions for the population and the environment by strengthening PCB environmental management systems and eliminating contaminated oil and equipment currently being used or stored so as to meet the goal of eliminating 2,000 tons of PCB in an environmentally friendly manner.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Tons of PCBs eliminated (tons and cost per ton)

baseline.comment: The latest estimate based on information from control bodies and sectoral estimates amounts to 3515 tons of PCBs (contaminated oil and equipment)

target.comment: Report on the elimination of 2,000 tons of contaminated oil and equipment by project end indicating mode of destruction used and cost per ton.

actual.comment:
During this reporting period, the Project can acredit dechlorination of 175,000 litres of PCB-contaminated oil, with a total of 700 tons of decontaminated wastes, done by the Project´s co-funders.
In addition, during this reporting period a total of 449 tons of PCB wastes were exported for final disposal to France consisting in 31.5 tons of capacitors, 37 tons of contaminated oils,378,5 tons of more than 210 transformers and 2 tons of residues.
Hence, the Project can prove that, since its inception and until June 30, 2015, Argentina has decontaminated more than 8,600 tons, of which 1,212 tons were exported to France for final disposal and over 7,450 tons were decontaminated by private operators. Of this total, the 22% can be directly assigned to Project`s efforts or co-funder activities.
It should be noted that, since 2013, particularly after the entry into force of SAyDS Resolution No 522/14, there has been an exponential growth in the tonnage that was disposed of through exports.
Within the scope of its objectives, the project was directly involved in the drafting, follow-up, approval, and effective implementation of the above resolution, which simplified the export process.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of environmental/industrial enforcement officers trained in PCB management.

target.comment: Environmental enforcement authorities in the provinces duly strengthened from a technical, legal and institutional standpoint to control and monitor PCB environmental management and their elimination.

actual.comment:
During the reporting period 79 people were trained in environmental sound management of PCBs including environmental and electricity-sector authorities, technicians and operators from electric power distributors, as well as local and provincial environmental inspectors, among others.
Since its launch and up until June 2015, the Project has trained more than 300 people.
Additionally, and to supplement the face-to-face training sessions, a series of tools have been developed to provide technical, legal, and institutional support. The following are worth noting:
1) Technical Operating Procedures Manual,
2) Technical Specifications for temporary PCB storage sites,
3) Compilation, updating and assessment of scientific studies on human exposure to PCBs, and
4) Compilation of all current PCB-related legislation.
All of these tools have been edited, published and distributed throughout the provinces during this reporting period
Also, they can be accessed freely through the Project's institutional website. http://www.ambiente.gob.ar/?idseccion=327
On the other hand, the Project is developing other technical training tools for the different actors participating in the PCB management process. These include:
1) Management manual to prevent PCB contamination in electrical transformers during repair and maintenance", and
2) Proposal to develop a Quality Assurance and Quality Control Programme for PCB analysis laboratories in Argentina.
Furthermore, the Project has developed fluent communication channels with the provinces and the electricity sector in order to share information concerning efforts to eliminate PCBs.
This communication supports different actors to learn about and become trained in the methods and/or technologies available to manage PCBs.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: National PCB management system in place and number of provinces participating.

target.comment: A national PCB environmental management system implemented in the provinces and in coordination with the national environmental authority.

actual.comment:
In line with the Law 25670 on PCB Management and its regulatory executive order, the Project is in the process of developing the guidelines for a national strategy to eliminate PCBs.
This strategy is federal in nature, thus comprising the 24 Argentine provinces.
However, and pursuant to the federal political/territorial organization established by the National Constitution, the provinces enforce the regulations and the strategy as appropriate, depending on their own capabilities and specific situation.
Given the above, to date the Project has been concentrated its efforts on the PCB inventory, PCB disposal, and/or environmental management of PCBs, in 11 provincial jurisdictions plus the national jurisdiction.
To date, the Project has reached a framework agreement with 5 provinces described in the last period.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of provinces with updated PCB inventories.

target.comment: A national updated PCB inventory, with a mass balance on an information platform.

actual.comment:
During the reporting period PCBs inventories from 4 provinces where updated with new information. To date, the Project has PCBs inventory information from 14 provinces out of 24 provinces as well as the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires.
An IT platform has been developed to integrate all the information gathered and make it accessible so that each province may update data in a standardized way, and allow those whose inventory is outdated or not yet developed to do so using this tool.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Initial consultations with the main stakeholders and continuous communications with the public at large.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Communication plan with information and consultation meetings among stakeholders on the expected Project objectives and outcomes. Number of meetings held and percentage of participants

baseline.comment: Environmental enforcement authorities in the provinces, the small and medium owners/holders of PCBs, and the large users of the electricity sector have little information on their responsibilities within the framework of the Stockholm Convention and the national legislation for identifying and eliminating PCB stocks.

target.comment: Local governments trained and informed about PCB environmental management and interested in becoming a part of the Project.

actual.comment:
The Project continued to implement the communication plan having 36 meetings with the main stakeholders including PCBs owners, the electrical sector, environmental authorities, PCBs operators, among others.
Since its inception and until June 2015, the Project held meetings with local authorities from 15 provinces with the purpose of informing them about actions undertaken under the Project,
As previously stated, the Project has entered into agreements with 5 of these provinces where they commited to undertake necessary tasks to eliminate PCBs
Please note that the absence of such an agreement does not mean that the Province is unaware of the project or is not making efforts in that direction, but that it improving the management of PCBs through other means.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Environmental management plans implemented by companies of the electrical sector (generation, transportation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces).

baseline.comment: There is a gap between compliance with the Stockholm Convention at the federal and provincial levels.

target.comment: Generation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces with PCB environmental management plans and a programme for their elimination.

actual.comment:
With regard to the two pilot provinces, it should be noted that the cooperatives in Entre Rios are in the final stage of the PCB decontamination efforts throughout the provincial territory. A bidding process is under way to contract an operator to dechlorinate the remaining 1,021 contaminated units.
In the case of Formosa, one cooperative is already decontaminating 49 transformers summing a total of 16 tons and the other cooperative is surveying and sampling all of its transformers (more than 1,500).
In these two provinces, the Project has provided support and fundings in all tasks such as sampling transformers and decontaminating oils and equipment.
Apart from the pilot provinces, the Project has relevant gathered information from key actors in the electricity sector, including ATEERA, the Association of transporters of electricity and Project`s co-funder, which has purchased its own equipment to decontaminate transformers and has been doing so since 2010.
Among the major electricity generators, Centrales de la Costa Atlantica (Project co-funder) already has PCB-free equipment; also, large users in 11 provinces are exporting PCBs, while local distributors in 6 provinces are carrying out transformer dechlorination activities.
In all these stakeholders the Project has provided technical assistance and guidelines to ensure a rational sound management disposal of PCBs.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Awareness-raising and information campaign on preventing PCB pollution duly implemented with feedback from the public at large

target.comment: Awareness-raising and information campaign on the prevention of PCB pollution developed and implemented in pilot provinces and across the nation.

actual.comment:
The following communication efforts are worth noting:
- The Projects website has been finalized and updated: http://www.ambiente.gov.ar/?idseccion=327; moreover, it has been included in the official website of the Secretaria de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable (Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development).
An information and awareness-raising campaign on PCBs has been developed. This campaign was implemented in the Province of Buenos Aires, where main stakeholders are and reached an estimated number of 500,000 people. This campaign, scheduled to end in September this year, includes the dissemination of Project actions in 9 different audiovisual media. To this end, audiovisual and printed material has been prepared.
- The Project participated in the sessions held by the Secretaria de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable during Environment Week and developed an awareness raising campaign with more than 3,000 students and teachers participated.
- The Project’s national director presented the main actions and objectives reached in april at the Foro Regional de Municipios (Regional Municipalities Forum) held in the city of Mar del Plata with more than 200 people present.
- The Project has held information and awareness-raising workshops on PCB-related issues in the pilot provinces and in others interested provinces when requested.
- The Project Performed new workshops and information sessions on PCBs in the pilot provinces and two other provinces that requested so, Buenos Aires and Chubut.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Strengthening of the institutional capacity of the national and provincial governments of Argentina and of large PCB owners/holders for a safe and environmentally sound management of and final disposal of PCBs

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Reviewed and harmonized PCB legislation, validated by the national and provincial governments.

baseline.comment: There is a gap in policies, technical guidelines, institutional capacity and regulations between the national environmental authority and the provincial environmental enforcement authorities.Non-harmonization between the institutional capabilities and rules of the national and provincial environmental audits

target.comment: Two provinces under the pilot project with environmental enforcement authorities that have the rules and institutional capacity to monitor and control the proper application of a PCB environmental management system. .

actual.comment:
In 2014, the Project published and disseminated a compilation of regulations on PCBs at a national level and from all 24 provinces.
Based on this compilation, the Project is working in coordination with the Regulatory Authority of the Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development to develop a comparative analysis and a series of recommendations and/or suggestions in order to change, improve, and strengthen the regulations in place.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management.

baseline.comment: There are regulations at the national level and in some provinces but no monitoring and control capacity by environmental authorities.

target.comment: Inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management.

actual.comment: In this period more than 170 government agents have been trained in environmentally sound management, including environmental authorities, inspectors and environmental oversight officers. A total of 230 persons where trained since the Project`s inception.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: A sustainable training programme for large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCB-related risks and on PCB environmental management.

baseline.comment: Large users of the electricity sector (buildings and companies) are not aware of the risks to health and the environment brought about by inappropriate PCB environmental management.

target.comment: Large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCB-related risks and on PCB environmental management.

actual.comment: In this reporting period, over 25 people from the electricity sector have been trained, including authorities from electricity generation, transportation and distribution companies, as well as sector technicians and operators. A total of 70 persons where trained since the Project`s inception.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Inventario nacional de PCB actualizado con recopilación sistemática de datos y accesible a través de internet.

target.comment: A national, updated PCB inventory, including 80% of the information for the provinces.

actual.comment:
All the training efforts undertaken by the Project have included specific training in inventory taking and updating.
To date, the Project has information on PCB stocks in 15 provinces including Buenos Aires City. This information was submitted in different formats (hard copies, Excel spreadsheets, etc.). The project has standardised and consolidated all the information using a single format.
The information provided by the provinces shows a total of nearly 100,000 equipments, of which 81% are PCBs free, 12.5% have no analysis and 6.5% are contaminated with PCBs. Based on the number of users and power consumption, which are known values, the Project estimates values from jurisdictions and areas that have not provided information yet and it is estimated that the total number of transformers in the country reaches 1,000,000 transformers. With these estimates we can inform that the on-line database has at least the 10% of the total number of contaminated and not contaminated equipments.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: A national PCB environmental management system including an updated inventory, the labeling of equipment, the monitoring of stock elimination, and a protocol for risk assessment of contaminated sites.

target.comment: National Environmental Management System of PCB developed and Implemented including at least the 80% of the information of each province.

actual.comment:
In 2014, the Project developed an online platform for the management of the National Inventory of PCB Stocks. During this reporting period period, a second version of the platform was developed to add more features so that, besides managing inventory, reports could also be issued on the management and traceability of PCBs in Argentina.
The online platform now also includes other major actors such as PCB analysis laboratories, temporary storing sites, and repair shops.
Protocols and recommendations issued by the project to label equipment, barrels, samples and residue contaminated or possibly contaminated with PCBs were published in the Guide of Standard Operative Procedures. In this reporting period the Project has trained provincial authorities of the pilot provinces to apply these guidelines in their territories.
For the protocol for risk assessment of contaminated sites the Project had a work session with the National Programme for Environmental Management of Contaminated Sites (PROSICO) where new guidelines for contaminated sites with PCBs where discussed and included in their agenda. This area has no record of any contaminated site with PCBs yet

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: A laboratory certification programme for PCB testing implemented through INTI.

baseline.comment: Percentage of labs certified for PCBs

target.comment: Registro de certified labs accredited for PCB analysis.

actual.comment:
A national survey has been completed, the purpose of which was to learn about the technical capacities of laboratories for PCB analyses.
A technical document has been drafted containing all survey results, including an assessment of the situation.
Following the project’s strategic decision to encourage consensus-based technical developments, a workshop was held in July with 15 major laboratories and other relevant government agencies so as to submit the document for discussion and include their experience and contributions. Every year between 30 and 40 labs accredit PCBs analysis capacities in the National Institute of Industrial Technology. Most of them belong to Buenos Aires. The Projects efforts and strategy is to have accredited at least one lab in each region or province.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Temporary PCB storing sites at the local, regional and/or central levels duly set up and receiving technical support

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Evaluación de los requerimientos para la construcción y/o adecuación de depósitos temporales.

baseline.comment: The possibility of storing PCB contaminated oil and equipment by small and medium sized generation and distribution companies is quite limited.

target.comment: Requerimientos para la construcción y/o adecuación de depósitos temporales establecidos.

actual.comment: The Project has developed a technical specifications manual for the design and/or upgrading of sites used for the temporary storage of electrical transformers and PCB containers, including the possibility of performing decontamination operations in order to ensure their environmentally sustainable management.This manual was distributed to the provinces and is also available on the Project’s website.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Feasibility Studies for authorizing the operation of the temporary storing sites for PCB contaminated oil and equipment

baseline.comment: Since there are no regional storage sites it is not possible optimize PCB treatment and elimination costs.

target.comment: PCB regional storage sites duly established and accepted by users in the provinces for temporary storage.

actual.comment:
The Project has provided training, technical resources and oversight to a temporary storing site for electrical equipment to be decontaminated in the Province of Rio Negro.
In the Province of Entre Rios the project supported the adaptation of a storage site in the city of Concordia by providing materials and technical support.
Also, through an agreement with the Facultad de Ciencias de la Alimentacion de la Universidad de Entre Rios (School of Food Science of the University of Entre Rios), an additional environmental impact assessment and environmental baseline study were conducted for a site designated for decontamination of all the transformers in the province.
In the Province of Formosa, the Project has also helped with the adaptation of a site in the town of El Colorado, where the transformers belonging to the provinces’ electricity distribution cooperatives will be stockpiled and decontaminated.

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Development and implementation of a national PCB final disposal and destruction strategy

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: PCB final disposal and destruction strategy validated by national and provincial authorities.

baseline.comment: National efforts to meet the obligations of the Stockholm Convention are weakened by the lack of coordination between national and provincial environmental authorities.

target.comment: A feasibility study with options for treatment, decontamination and final disposal of PCBs, validated by stakeholders and including funding options.

actual.comment:
The Project has conducted a study on the PCB disposal capacity at a national level, including the technologies available on the local market. This assessment included the technologies used, infrastructure, territorial scope and operational costs, among other variables.
Additionally, during this period, the Project collected information on new technologies for the treatment and end disposal of PCBs being used in Latin America.

target.comment: A PCB treatment, decontamination and destruction strategy at the national level, validated by stakeholders and including financial resource options.

actual.comment:
The Project has drafted a document on guidelines for a national PCB elimination strategy, which includes an analysis of the country’s PCB disposal capabilities.
The document has been submitted for consideration to the major actors in the public and private sectors with a view to building consensus on its content.
Based on this process, a national decontamination and destruction strategy will be developed that will be agreed upon by all stakeholders and actors.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Advances on the implementation of two provincial experiences in PCB environmental management with a view to eliminating the stocks of small and medium-sized distribution cooperatives.

target.comment: Implementation of two provincial experiences in PCB environmental management with a view to eliminating the stocks of small and medium-sized distribution cooperatives.

actual.comment:
Entre Rios: In collaboration with local environmental authorities, the Project has implemented a PCB management programme. As part of its implementation, the province has communicated its stock of contaminated transformers (1,100 units belonging to 18 electric cooperatives).
An Environmental Impact Assessment was carried out to authorise the opening of a temporary storing site in the city of La Paz, which could not be used because the municipal authorities denied permission.
Ultimately, a site in Concordias industrial estate was selected.
An additional environmental impact assessment and environmental baseline study were conducted and the materials needed for the preparation/upgrading of the site were purchased.
Formosa: Although the Province of Formosa had conducted an initial survey of high-voltage transformers, it did not have an inventory of PCB stocks.
During this reporting period, a temporary storing site has been opened on the premises of El Colorado cooperative, and the operator in charge of decontaminating the 49 units has already been hired.
Finally, an invitation to tender has been issued to hire this year the company that will survey and sample 1,522 units belonging to the other cooperative, which decided to participate in the project after attending a training workshop facilitated by the Project’s technical team.

target.comment: Reduction of the national inventory through the project\\\'s proposed elimination of 2000 tons of PCB.

actual.comment:
The Project can prove that, since its inception and up to June 30, 2015, Argentina has disposed of 8,600 tons of PCB-contaminated oil and wastes.
Out of this quantity, 2,120 tons were exported in coordination with the national environmental authority, through the Transboundary Movements Unit, while 6,400 tons were disposed of through dechlorination actions carried out by private operators located in the country.
It should be noted that, since 2013, particularly after the entry into force of SAyDS Resolution No 522/14 which the project supported drafting and getting approved, there has been an exponential growth in the tonnage that was disposed of through exports (the resolution helped simplify the export process).
